intro: Orthosiphon somalensis, commonly known as the Somali horseleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
